intro: Canthium glaucum var. frangula, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowcalf or frangula, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows in moist woodlands and along stream banks. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptic to ovate in shape. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes and are followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties remain under study.
